thread.title: Ontario speeds through bill to ban winter disconnections for non-payment of hydro bills
thread.title_full: Ontario speeds through bill to ban winter disconnections for non-payment of hydro bills | Toronto Star

author: Rob Ferguson
title: Ontario speeds through bill to ban winter disconnections for non-payment of hydro bills
text:
Electricity consumers who are behind on their bills will no longer be subject to winter disconnections after the Ontario government quickly passed a ban Wednesday morning. “No one should ever be put at risk of disconnection in the winter,” Energy Minister Glenn Thibeault said in a statement.
The legislation, called the Protecting Vulnerable Energy Consumers Act, will get royal assent later in the day and gives the Ontario Energy Board power to end disconnections during cold weather.
It’s not clear how quickly the OEB can put the ban into force, but Thibeault has said most local utilities in the province have already agreed to voluntarily end winter disconnects.
However, he said Tuesday legislation would only be tabled if some utilities refused to stop the practice, forcing the government to take stronger action.
  Progressive Conservative Leader Patrick Brown said he was “glad to see that all three parties joined together to pass a bill ending winter disconnections.”
“Unfortunately, this comes after far too many families and seniors were forced to suffer in the cold without power because the Wynne Liberals dragged their feet and played political games,” he added.
Both the Conservatives and NDP said the government erred by putting the winter disconnection ban into a larger piece of omnibus legislation, the Burden Reduction Act, introduced last June.
The PCs supported it but the New Democrats did not, saying it objected to provisions on the sale of Ontario Place and weaker workplace protections.
That it took until late February to pass a winter disconnection bill shows the Liberals are “out of touch,” Brown charged.
The energy board does not have statistics on how many customers were disconnected from hydro for non-payment during this winter season.
